What Makes a Good Story
چی چی چیرۆکێکی باش دروست دەکات

A good story is engaging to a diverse audience around the world. It captures their attention, while conveying information about an event, a place, or a person. It can pique their curiosity or show a universal experience through something specific. And it is built around strong pictures.

Specific Yet Universal
تایبەت هێشتا جیهانی

A good story focuses on a specific experience or individual in a broader story, in a way that makes it interesting and accessible to people from different backgrounds and cultures. The journalist takes the audience into a world other than their own, to meet the people at the center of the story. This allows the audience to see themselves, their families, or their friends in the story and relate to the narrative.

Stephanie Garcia from Dinosaur Park Valley in Texas tells us about her discovery of what is thought to be the world's longest dinosaur trackway.

Digital video explainer that reveals the devastating environmental impact behind your every day shopping list. Many viewers may not know what palm oil is. We go into a grocery store to show how it is used in more than half of all packaged groceries - including soap, shampoo, and ice cream.  We explain how palm oil is harvested and processed. And we explain that palm oil is also used to produce “bio-fuel.”  Ironically, this was supposed to an environmentally-friendly alternative to fossil fuels. Journey to Wuhan

Wuhan, China was the original epicenter of the Covid-19 pandemic that started in late 2019. As the virus began to spread and sicken more people, David Culver and his team traveled there in January 2020 to document what was happening. But less than two days after they got there, the city was preparing to impose a lockdown, and David and his colleagues had to leave in a hurry.

David and his team didn't know what they would actually be able to gather when they got to Wuhan.  But they prioritized getting video of life on the city's streets and the seafood market believed to be the origin of the outbreak.  They also knew the journey itself would likely yield some good pictures.

Discussion

David Culver and his team knew from their storyboard and planning that the first priority in this story was getting strong visuals. The opening shots we see are scenes from the streets of Wuhan around the seafood market. The pacing of the narrative moves along fairly quickly, as it gives the viewer a glimpse of a city on the brink of crisis. When we see David in reporter stand-ups, he uses them to explain the scenes the viewer is seeing.

دەیڤد کولڤەر و تیمەکەی لە تەختەی چیرۆکەکەیان زانیان و پلان دادەنێن کە ئەولەویەتی یەکەم لەم چیرۆکەدا بینینی بەهێز دەبێت. ئەو تەقە کراوەیەی کە دەیبینین دیمەنن لە شەقامەکانی ووهان لە دەوروبەری بازاڕی خواردنی دەریایی. بۆشایی چیرۆکەکە بە خێرایی دەجوڵێتەوە، چونکە سەرنجێک دەداتە بینەری شارێک لە لێواری قەیرانەوە. کاتێک دەیڤد لە راگەیەنراوەکانی پەیامنێردا دەبینین، بۆ ڕوونکردنەوەی ئەو دیمەنانەی کە بینەر دەیبینێت بەکاری دەهێنێت.
Escape from Wuhan
هەڵاتن لە ووهان

David and his team thought they were going to have a week to report from Wuhan. Instead, they only had two days. So they had to make adjustments and be flexible. Although they didn't have time to get everything they had hoped for, the story changed when the city-wide lockdown became imminent. Getting out of Wuhan before the lockdown went into effect became the second half of the story, and the journey back to Beijing became the narrative for it.

دەیڤد و تیمەکەی پێیان وابوو کە هەفتەیەکیان دەبێت بۆ ڕاپۆرتدان لە ووهان. لە جیاتی ئەوە، ئەوان تەنها دوو ڕۆژیان هەبوو. بۆیە ئەوان دەبوا هەمواری بکەن و نەرم بن. هەرچەندە ئەوان کاتیان نەبوو بۆ بەدەست هێنانی هەموو ئەو شتانەی کە هیوایان بۆ دەخواست، بەڵام چیرۆکەکە گۆڕا کاتێک داخستنی فراوانی شار نزیک بووەتەوە. دەرچوون لە ووهان پێش ئەوەی قوفڵکردنەکە بچێتە ناو نیوەی دووەمی چیرۆکەکەوە، وە گەشتەکە بۆ پەکین بوو بە چیرۆک بۆی.
